title: Mariah Carey confirmed for Walkers Christmas TV ad 2019
text:
All she wants for Crisps-mas… (Picture: PA)

UK telly is no stranger to weird and wonderful ads – just look at Robert De Niro flogging Warburtons bagels.

But this Christmas, things are getting stranger – and even more diva-ish.

Mariah Carey has been confirmed as the face of Walkers’ Christmas campaign, and it’s a testament to how bizarre 2019 has been that that’s not the weirdest thing we’ve written this year.

The 49-year-old has been signed up to front the crisps company’s festive ad which is set to launch in November.

The All I Want For Christmas singer said: ‘Everyone knows how festive I am, and it’s been fun getting into the holiday spirit this year with Walkers crisps – they’re irresistible!

‘I can’t say too much about the campaign yet, but there may be some fun twists at the end!’

We’re guessing a chorus of All I Want For Christmas Is Crisps?

The campaign image sees Mariah dressed in a sequinned red dress with a plunging neckline, standing next to a sleigh on the show, while holding a bag of Walkers Ready Salted.

Emily Atack previously joined Gary Lineker for a campaign (Picture: Walkers)

While Mariah may seem like a leftfield choice for the Walkers ads, usually fronted by Gary Lineker, she is pretty much the modern day patron saint of Christmas.

The star’s 1994 album Merry Christmas – featuring All I Want For Christmas Is You, festive classics like Christmas (Baby Please Come Home) and Santa Claus Is Comin’ To Town and hymns including Silent Night and O Holy Night – is celebrating its 25th anniversary this year and will be re-released on 1 November.

And the Grammy Award winner is taking her All I Want For Christmas festive show to Las Vegas and across the US in November and December.

No word on whether she’ll feature an ode to salt and vinegar in her setlist.
